thread.title: Albanian killer deported from UK sneaks BACK past ‘weak’ border and now runs car wash
thread.title_full: Albanian killer deported from UK sneaks BACK past ‘weak’ border and now runs car wash

title: Albanian killer deported from UK sneaks BACK past ‘weak’ border and now runs car wash
text:
“It shows how weak our border controls are.” Tory MP Philip Davies 
How he managed to slip past UK Border Control unchecked is not yet clear. 
The rules state that foreign nationals sentenced to more than four years in jail cannot live in the UK. 
A source told The Sun: “He should have been picked up by Border Force when he entered the country. 
“The fact he wasn’t suggests maybe he arrived clandestinely or didn’t disclose the conviction.” 
GOOGLE SUCCESSFUL: Cokaj is listed as the owner of thus car wash Policing the migrants Friday, 9th December 2016 As migrants clash with each other in over crowded camps across Europe, we take a look through the hard task of policing the migrant crisis in Europe. 1 / 75 EPA Moroccan Police look at immigrants trying to jump the six-meter-high fence in Ceuta, Spanish enclave on the north of Africa, 09 December 2016. 
Cokaj, who was on interpol’s most wanted list, was locked up in 1994 for stabbing a man to death in his homeland. 
He fled to the UK, where he gained access by posing as a refugee under a fake name, according to reports. 
Once in the UK, he set up a car wash in in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, where he met his wife. 
But in 2006, his conviction came to light and after a three-year extradition process and he was sent packing to Albania in 2009. 
The Home Office said: “This Government puts the safety of our country first. 
“That’s why we’ve taken action like introducing ‘deport first, appeal later’ to stop this kind of thing happening.” Related articles
